designScenario.name: Ventilation System
designScenario.description: This design outlines a Ventilation System for aviation applications, focusing on maintaining optimal airflow, filtration efficiency, and pressure management within the aircraft cabin. The system is engineered to ensure passenger comfort, air quality, and safety by integrating advanced airflow regulation, multi-stage filtration, and pressure control mechanisms. It aligns with aviation standards for reliability, rapid response, and fail-safe operations.

details.description: Maintain cabin airflow between 500 CFM and 2000 CFM to ensure adequate ventilation and prevent stagnation.
The system must achieve 99.97% filtration efficiency for particles as small as 0.3 microns using HEPA filters.
Control pressure differentials between cabin zones to prevent air leakage and maintain structural integrity, within a range of 0.2 - 0.5 inches H2O.
The system must respond to airflow or pressure deviations within 5 seconds to maintain stability.
Implement redundant airflow paths and fail-safe dampers to maintain critical ventilation in case of primary system failure.
All components must support modular replacement and upgrades to reduce downtime and align with aviation maintenance practices.

systemComponents.name: Air Circulation Unit
systemComponents.description: Responsible for generating and directing airflow through the cabin using high-efficiency blowers and adjustable dampers.

subComponents.name: Blower Assembly
subComponents.description: High-capacity centrifugal blower designed to deliver regulated airflow under varying cabin conditions.

subComponents.name: Air Dampers
subComponents.description: Variable position dampers to control airflow direction and volume.

subComponents.name: Air Intake Module
subComponents.description: Filtered external air intake with pressure regulation for fresh air supply.

systemComponents.name: Ductwork System
systemComponents.description: Network of pressurized ducts and valves for distributing conditioned air to all cabin zones.

subComponents.name: Primary Ducts
subComponents.description: Rigid aluminum ducts with corrosion-resistant coating for high-pressure airflow.

subComponents.name: Zonal Valves
subComponents.description: Electronically controlled valves to regulate airflow distribution between cabin sections.

subComponents.name: Sealing Mechanisms
subComponents.description: Gasketed joints and pressure-sealed connections to prevent air leakage.

systemComponents.name: Filtration Module
systemComponents.description: Multi-stage filtration system to remove particulates, microbes, and contaminants from cabin air.

subComponents.name: Pre-Filter
subComponents.description: Coarse mesh filter for large particles and debris.

subComponents.name: HEPA Filter
subComponents.description: High-Efficiency Particulate Air filter for 0.3 micron particle capture.

subComponents.name: Post-Filter
subComponents.description: Activated carbon filter to absorb odors and volatile organic compounds.

systemComponents.name: Air Quality Sensors
systemComponents.description: Suite of sensors monitoring particulate levels, CO2 concentration, and pressure differentials.

subComponents.name: Particulate Sensor
subComponents.description: Laser-based sensor for real-time particle count measurement.

subComponents.name: CO2 Sensor
subComponents.description: Nondispersive infrared sensor for cabin CO2 monitoring.

subComponents.name: Pressure Sensor Array
subComponents.description: Differential pressure sensors to detect zone pressure imbalances.

systemComponents.name: Control Subsystem
systemComponents.description: Central control unit managing airflow, filtration, and pressure parameters based on sensor feedback.

subComponents.name: Main Controller
subComponents.description: Microprocessor-based controller for real-time algorithm execution.

subComponents.name: User Interface
subComponents.description: Touchscreen display for flight crew to monitor and adjust ventilation parameters.

subComponents.name: Communication Module
subComponents.description: Avionics bus interface for data exchange with aircraft systems.

relationships.description: The Blower Assembly is a core component of the Air Circulation Unit.
The Control Subsystem processes sensor data to adjust ventilation parameters.
The Ductwork System depends on the Air Circulation Unit for airflow supply.
The Filtration Module is integrated into the Air Circulation Unit's airflow path.
The Control Subsystem regulates Ductwork System valves and dampers.

attributes.name: airflowRate
attributes.description: Airflow volume maintained to ensure adequate cabin ventilation.

attributes.name: filtrationEfficiency
attributes.description: HEPA filter efficiency for particulate removal.

attributes.name: pressureDifferential
attributes.description: Allowed pressure difference between cabin zones to prevent structural stress.

attributes.name: responseTime
attributes.description: Maximum time to respond to airflow or pressure deviations.

attributes.name: modularityLevel
attributes.description: Design allows for individual module swaps without full system disassembly.

comments.body: Manages cabin air circulation and filtration with pressure/temperature constraints
